page.title: 05EDUCATION IN HEMEL HEMPSTEAD
page.content: There are only primary and secondary schools in this area. We have to go into Watford or Hemel for college. Children go to the Infants at five. They do Maths and use Unifix cubes to help them. They have a lady to help with their reading. We go into the Juniors between seven and eleven. When you move up to a new class you have a lot of tests and when you move to Secondary school. We do topics, language, maths and PE. We transfer to secondary in our twelfth year. Most people go to Longdean or Mountbatten. You study for your 'O' and 'A' levels there. When you leave at 16 or 18 you either get a job or go to university, depending on your qualifications. Some people go to private schools. The one in this area is called Abbots Hill. Pupils go there from 4 to 18. Some schools wear uniform, but not all.
